intro: Anaphalis sinica var. viscosissima, commonly known as the sticky hair vetch, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its sticky leaves help reduce water loss and deter herbivores. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
